subject: Football
Police
lead_paragraph: Arizona police pulled over Chicago Bears defensive tackle Tank Johnson early yesterday morning, the latest legal trouble for a player already suspended for the first eight games of the 2007 season. The police in Gilbert, Ariz., pulled Johnson over at 3:30 a.m. and cited him for “being impaired to the slightest degree,” Sgt. Andrew Duncan, told The Chicago Tribune in a story posted on its Web site. Johnson had been going 40 miles an hour in a 25 m.p.h. zone when the officer “made observations that led him to believe Johnson was impaired,” Duncan said. Earlier this month, Roger Goodell, the N.F.L. commissioner, suspended Johnson for eight games for violating the league’s toughened personal conduct policy.
